status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Is this a unit test for java runner harness? (/cc kenn)

There are two assertions baked into one, so hard to say which is failing: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/8ffce6b8a1f8f95073cda08ee84e9b48c36aa42e/runners/java-fn-execution/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/fnexecution/control/DefaultJobBundleFactoryTest.java#L475

Assert.assertTrue(System.currentTimeMillis() - tms >= 100 && closed.get());

The failure means the test really did fail. It looks like it is supposed to wait for a timer to fire after 100ms and that timer will set the closed atomic reference. If either of these is false, then the assertion is running when it shouldn't be. Or concurrency in the Java memory model is biting in some way.
Would it help to break the asserts in two? Should we close/reduce the priority if there is not much we can do about this.
It looks like this test hasn't failed in any of the currently saved runs. I'll split up the assertion so this is more clear if it happens again and close the jira for now.

Hello! Due to a bug in our Jira configuration, this issue had status:Resolved but resolution:Unresolved.

I am bulk editing these issues to have resolution:Fixed

If a different resolution is appropriate, please change it. To do this, click the "Resolve" button (you can do this even for closed issues) and set the Resolution field to the right value.
